(French MOD photo) 
Defense News: Still tiny, the design of France’s next aircraft carrier takes shape 
PARIS — The French Ministry of Defense and industry leaders presented a first look, in model form, at the nation’s next-generation, nuclear-powered aircraft carrier this week during the biennial Euronaval trade conference here. 
The new carrier is expected to replace the French navy’s current aircraft carrier, the Charles de Gaulle, by 2038. Naval Group and Chantiers de l’Atlantique are building the ship together under the temporary joint venture MO Porte Avions, and Technic Atome will provide the two nuclear reactors to power the ship.

articles.description:
Washington Post: Norway on edge over drone sightings, arrest of son of Putin confidante 
BRUSSELS — Norwegian officials warned Thursday that there could be more arrests after at least seven Russians — including the son of a close associate of President Vladimir Putin — were detained in the span of weeks for flying drones or taking pictures near sensitive areas, prompting an investigation by the domestic intelligence service. 
The news comes as Norway and other countries move to secure critical infrastructure in the wake of the sabotage of the Nord Stream gas pipelines. 
It follows weeks of reports of drone sightings in its vast offshore oil and gas fields, as well as recent sightings at Norwegian airports. 
On Wednesday, Norway’s prime minister, Jonas Gahr Store, blamed foreign intelligence — and indirectly pointed a finger a Russia. 
“It is not acceptable that foreign intelligence is flying drones over Norwegian airports. Russians are not allowed to fly drones in Norway,” he said, according to Norwegian broadcaster NRK.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: The new reality in Norway. If you are a Russian national carrying a drone near critical infrastructure, you will be arrested. 
Norway On Alert After Drone Sightings Near Critical infrastructure And The Arrest Of Russian Nationals

Defense News: Worried China might seize Taiwan sooner, Navy chief pushes readiness  
WASHINGTON — The U.S. Navy has adopted a “fight tonight” mentality as both China and Russia grow more aggressive, the chief of naval operations said, meaning the service must become more ready and more lethal for a near-term conflict. 
Adm. Mike Gilday said he stands by prioritizing readiness, then lethality and then growing the size of the fleet, but said during remarks at the Atlantic Council Wednesday the potential for a conflict with China in the next couple years makes it important to do all three.   
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: No one in the US (civilian and military) is ready to "fight tonight".

articles.description:
Rishi Sunak is among the favourites to take over as PMCredit: PA   
The SUN: 'GAME IS UP' Who could replace Liz Truss as UK Prime Minister now that she has stepped down? 
LIZ Truss has announced she will step down as Prime Minister after just 44 days in power. 
But who will replace Ms Truss now she has been forced out as Conservative Party leader? And who is the favourite for the job? 
The PM announced the news earlier today in a statement to the nation at Downing Street. 
It came after days of pressure, with MPs saying she had no choice but to go. 
A Tory leadership race will now begin and a new PM will be chosen in the next WEEK. 
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: This is my prediction from last week before Liz Truss resigned as PM (link here), and I am still holding to it ....
.... IMHO Liz Truss' days of being PM are numbered. I will not be surprised if she asked by senior Conservative members next week to resign. 
As to who will replace her? 
My money is on Rishi Sunak (link here). His image of being Britain's "Obama" will probably appeal to enough members in his party to support him as the next UK leader, as well as his globalist ties. 
As to the bigger question .... will Rishi Sunak be a good leader? 
I have my doubts. 
The decision to wage economic war against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine has devastated European economies, and in turn a number of EU governments have been defeated in recent elections. Rishi Sunak does not strike me as someone who has the understanding that the EU must reverse its Russia strategy, nor the leadership qualities to make the case on why this must be done. 
Another prediction. The Labor Party is well positioned to win the next election.
articles.title: Who Will Replace Liz Truss As UK Prime Minister?

Russian President Vladimir Putin chairs a meeting with members of the Security Council via a video link at a residence outside Moscow, Oct. 19, 2022. Photo by Sputnik/Sergey Ilyin /Kremlin via REUTERS  
 Reuters: Putin boosts Russia's war footing with troops on back foot in Ukraine 
KYIV/MIKOLAIV — President Vladimir Putin ordered all of Russia to support the war effort in Ukraine on Wednesday, as the Russian-appointed administration of Kherson prepared to evacuate the only regional capital Moscow has captured during its invasion. 
Images of people using boats to flee the southern city were broadcast by Russian state TV, which portrayed the exodus – from the right to left bank of the River Dnipro – as an attempt to evacuate civilians before it became a combat zone. 
The Russian-installed chief of Kherson – one of four Ukrainian regions unilaterally claimed by Moscow where Putin declared martial law on Wednesday – said about 50,000-60,000 people would be moved out in the next six days. 
 Read more .... 
Update: Putin demands all-Russia war effort as he declares martial law in occupied Ukraine (Reuters)   
WNU Editor: There was a major shift today in the Russian media narrative on the conflict in Ukraine and the West. The message is that Russia is under attack from the West and its proxies in Ukraine, and the country must now prepare itself for war.
articles.title: With The Imposition Of Martial Law in Ukraine Followed By Other Measures That All Russians Must Now Follow, Putin Has Put Russia On A War Footing

The Atomic Weapons Establishment at Aldermaston, Berkshire   
SKY News: UK nuclear warhead maintenance staff to vote on strike action 
Nearly 2,000 staff at the Atomic Weapons Establishment (AWE) - a company that develops and services the Trident nuclear deterrent - will hold a ballot on industrial action for two weeks from 24 October. 
Workers who build and maintain the UK's nuclear warheads are to vote on strike action over a pay dispute. 
Nearly 2,000 staff at the Atomic Weapons Establishment (AWE) - a company that develops and services the Trident nuclear deterrent - will hold a ballot on industrial action for two weeks from 24 October.  It comes after staff at the Berkshire-based firm rejected a 5% pay increase and additional lump sum. 
Read more ....
WNU Editor: Inflation is over 10% in the UK. The offer of a 5% pay increase is actually a 5% decrease. If I was a worker at this company I would be voting to go on strike.
articles.title: Workers Who Build And Maintain The UK's Nuclear Warheads Are Voting On Strike Action

articles.description:
Bloomberg: Chinese Economists Tally Cost of Putin’s War, Warn on Deep Scars 
(Bloomberg) -- Russia faces a sharp and prolonged slump in its real income as international sanctions over President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine leave deep scars on its economy, according to a study by two Chinese academics. 
The severing of trade links and access to multinational production may cut real income by almost 12% and result in a “permanent decline in real gross domestic product” for Russia, Xiayi Du and Zi Wang from Shanghai University of Finance and Economics said in the study published in the journal Economics Letters.
“This welfare loss is mainly due to losing access to foreign final goods and intermediates,” they said. 
One of the most downbeat assessments to date of the fallout from Putin…
articles.title: Chinese Economists Calculate The Cost To Russia For Its War Against Ukraine

articles.description:
Washington Post: McCarthy signals GOP-led House likely to oppose more aid to Ukraine 
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.) is signaling that if Republicans win the House majority in next month’s midterm elections, the GOP is likely to oppose more aid to Ukraine in its war with Russia. 
Since the invasion in February the majority of congressional Republicans and Democrats have united in authorizing billions of dollars in U.S. military and humanitarian assistance to Kyiv as a geopolitical and moral stand against Vladimir Putin’s aggression.    
Read more ....   
WNU Editor: If the US ends its military involvement/participation/direction in the Russia - Ukraine war, the Ukraine government will fall faster than the Afghan government did when the Taliban launched their offensive in the spring of 2021 to take back power. 
As to the remarks from House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-Calif.). This is all talk. All Democrats and most Republicans support this war .... Armed Services Committee Republican says ‘vast majority’ of GOP supports US assistance to Ukraine (The Hill). 
The only Republican politician who is asking the right questions on where is all of this money and weapons are going to is Senator Rand Paul and maybe one or two Republicans in the House. 
Will A Republican Run Congress Oppose More Aid To Ukraine?
